reviews.text: Are you a lover of modern art of all mediums? Are you interested in Slovenian artists and the inspiration behind their works? If so, this museum is not to be missed. There are many interesting paintings, sculptures, video artworks, and other curiosities. If you are squeamish about you or your children seeing nudity, this gallery may not be your cup of tea. But if you are comfortable seeing a few naked body art works sprinkled in with the other art work, do stop by. The museum has a downstairs coffee bar/lounge and lecture hall for talks.  I really enjoyed the museum and its art works.

Half of the space is permanent exhibition and other half is actual and temporary, usually open three times a year for a few months; always interesting topic. 
Otherwise calm and chilly space, where time and thoughts run slower tempo.

I was left speechless. The exhibits are so beautifully pieced together that it is almost impossible to peel your eyes off them. You will need about an hour to go through the whole gallery, after which you can relax in the cafè bellow the gallery itself. The gallery also provides a student discount, so be sure to bring your students' card!

Beautiful bulging and interesting permanent collection. You will need 30 minutes-1 hour to see it all. The temporary exhibition space is big and well organised. The thicket costs only 5 euros: an extra reason to have this insight into modern Slovenia. Visit the coffee downstairs if you have a little time.
One of my favourite places in Ljubljana to have a nice cup of coffee or tea and stay close to modern art. Highly recommended.

Fabulous museum. 10 lei entry. Lockers available but you need a 0.50 lei coin. Wonderful information on the history of Romania, then there is a Roman section with all the amazing friezes from the Roman column of traian. The treasury with all the gold and jewels is amazing! National costumes on the way out and a gun exhibition on until the end of April. Last tickets at 4.15pm. Need around 1hour.

Small museum with great stuff. We enjoyed the temporary exhibit. We learned a lot about how Romania came to be in it's modern form. The jewelry and sparkly things were awesome. That was only part of the museum not in English.

A great way to spend the day, if you have the time. Several exhibits have fantastic paintings, sculptures and tapestries from all over Europe, with the Romanian historical exhibit displaying a large collection that I'm sure can not be found anywhere else.

I got a bit disappointed. It was not as big as I expected it to be. Surely there has been made a quite amount of effort and the treasure rooms were interesting. Hope that the next time there will be a bigger variety of exhibits.
Very impressed with the exhibits. Surprised there was no mention of the time around 1989. For 10 lei it's a great destination and the souvenir shop is reasonably priced.

Huge building, interesting from the architectural point of view. Museum itself has exhibitions on prehistory, a bit on stone and iron age, something on nomad tribes etc. I found the part on ethnic minorities in Kazakhstan very interesting. Museum could do with some refurbishing, it could be more interactive.

Enormous stylish building with interesting spaces to fill yet it looks like a High school end of the year science-history fair. This Museum is so badly curated !!! The information in English, French or German are whimsical. This Museum is a pale echo to the one in Nursultan (Astana).
The reward to go there is located on the 2nd floor with bits and bobs on the Soviet era spacial program and, possibly, one if the 3 Sputnik prototype... no information available!!!
The Museum shop is unbelievably lame.
Has lots of exhibits in 4 large halls. Some are more interesting than others but well worth a stop.

The building is impressive and located in a lovely park. 

The museum itself is okay, there are a few nice objects but nothing that will blow your mind. Mostly recreations rather than actual archeological artifacts. There was a very charming series of dioramas about the various ethnic groups living in Kazakhstan. 

Go if you have the time, but don’t worry about missing it, if coming here strains your itinerary.
Nice. Ticket of adults 300 tenge. For students 200 tenge and pupils 100 tenge.
Go save/fix to Miami Consulate First. Hire someone responsable. 2 months to schedule a passport. It's a joke. Thanks for nothing
Maravilhosa. His buildings are so iconic and satisfying.
By far my favourite building in the city because of its stark and minimalist beauty. Excellent photo opportunities around the mirror moat that surrounds the building.
Ok
Guided tour. Beautiful.

The museum is a vast one housing many different types of relics. It would take you an entire day to explore the museum if you are into getting to know the details of almost every relic present there.

There is also a 4000 years old Egyptian mummy preserved in a glass case.

They have an adequate number of benches at every floor for you to rest your legs from walking around in the museum.

You can visit the museum many times and I am sure you will discover new things each time you go there.

Huge collection that might take entire day if you really keen. But staff here not helpful and no guide for available. Cloak room is there but don't keep valuable items. Clean restroom. 2 stories that can be assessed by wheelchair too but no lift. There is a 4000yr old mummy from Egypt.  And geology section is vast. Especially good for kids to learn Biology. They close it at 4.30 sharp

It's a really nice museum with lot of interesting n informative things to keep u interested. The building is of British- India architecture. Cool experience n suitable for all age groups. Many tourists visit this museum with some saying it to be one of the best in India. Entry ticket/fee is Rs. 50 for adults n 20 for below 18 yrs. No fee for 3yrs or less. I especially loved the mummy.

It's considered as a largest and oldest museum in INDIA.
It has many galleries to display art, zoology, Geology, Economic etc.

It's a 2 story rectangular shaped building in which the middle space is kept empty for Lawn.

I almost spend 3 hours here. If you will check each item one by one then  one day won't even enough for you.

Recently that is from march 1st 2019 they increase the entry fee.

Now entry fee is  ₹50 For adult. And ₹20 for kids above 5.
Camera charges 
₹50 for mobile phones only for photo not video.
₹100 for camera only for photo not video.
₹2000 for small video camera
₹5000 camera with stand.

Parking facility is available by a 3rd party it's under the flyover bridge and it's very expensive like ₹20 for each hour for bike (we end up with paying ₹60 for less than 3 hours).

Tips:
Lift facility is not there so you have to prepare for it.
Free Cold Water is available in the ground floor.

This place is located in a pristine location, but there is no air conditioning. Moreover the price has been revised from 20 to ₹50. But the print still says 20. Don't know what is going on. These days they remain open on weekends till 8pm. The display is not anything great to look. The collection is at par with other museums in the country. There is a dinosaur and mamoth and a blue whale skeleton. Also a mummy is there which are most of the key attraction points.
